intro: Scabiosa sirnakia, commonly known as the Sirnak scabious, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Scabiosa sirnakia is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
